title: Band, 16th century
medium:
Medium: silk of many colors, gold metallic foil wound onto yellow silk, silver metallic foil wound onto white silk.
Technique: needle lace
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Border of gold metallic lace with colored silks in a pattern of floral and foliated forms and animal images. Gold is wound around a linen core to create a metallic thread.

tombstone.epitaph:
Band, 16th century.
16th century. Medium: silk of many colors, gold metallic foil wound onto yellow silk, silver metallic foil wound onto white silk.
Technique: needle lace. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-50-205.
